title: yeosaga
author: yeosaga
content: Anyone else seen these government issued coins? Has this been done before?

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: That coin is dope. I'm not familiar. Has anyone heard of these?

comments.author: yeosaga
comments.body: Quote from: blucepheus on July 03, 2022, 06:09:04 PMThat coin is dope. I'm not familiar. Has anyone heard of these?I didn't want to be seen as shill, but they are on JMB

comments.author: yeosaga
comments.body: "On this board, you cannot delete your posts until 24 hours have passed from posting them. You could edit the post to be blank and then come back in 24 hours."If a MOD could please delete?

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Not government issued. Coinmaker just using crypto name to sell coins. 1000 satoshis is 20 cents. Cost more then that to swipe it. Although coin and holo are beautiful and ill probably still buy one

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: also worth noting - the coins do not come with an address - so there is no way to even verify the funding. Although even with an address you then have to trust that the key under hologram belongs to the address provided and then have to trust that the key is secure.I dont see them taking all that much security with 1000 sats. even their website states it is not worth peeling the hologram.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: I’m still not convinced they even are funded. Pretty sure I read they “could be funded”. I don’t trust this company either way personally.  What did they call it, “The United Crypto States” ? lol

comments.author: TxCryptoKid
comments.body: I have a few of these. Nice looking coins. They're funded but only .00001₿ (20¢) I think. Here is the MFG site, it has all the details. https://ucs-coins.com/ I pre ordered mine and they took 3-4 months to arrive, but I'm assuming they're in stock now. IIRC they shipped from somewhere in Europe.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on July 03, 2022, 06:33:48 PMThey look good at least.Yes. While the coins look nice, the value is more in their material than in the amount of satoshis. Nevertheless, I would like to own one! Who knows, one day 1000 satoshi might be worth enough to peel off that sticker.

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: I’ve got a few but if I’m not mistaken they aren’t actually loaded…. It’s some weird process once you find the actual site and read about them. Def cool pieces though

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: This coin actually pisses me off. Trying to piggyback on the success of Casascius and Lealana without actually putting in the work to be legit. Lets pretend to be physical bitcoin to get the customers. No address, not funded. I bet there's a 1-800 number under the holo. Please call number and well mail you 2 dimes. $4.99 shipping and handling.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on July 04, 2022, 12:18:56 AMThis coin actually pisses me off. Trying to piggyback on the success of Casascius and Lealana without actually putting in the work to be legit. Lets pretend to be physical bitcoin to get the customers. No address, not funded. I bet there's a 1-800 number the holo. Please call number and well mail you 2 dimes. $4.99 shipping and handling. Sounds like the Hyperion Gold scam, the 4 guardians coins. Anything from TWC is suspect to me nowadays, they often don't even have the coins they are selling. This one pisses me off as well, I mean I don't mind they are piggybacking myself, but the fact they claim each is loaded with 5k sats or some bullshit. I can already tell if there is some website involved, it will be a scam as far as getting any btc from them.  Where is @ChiBitCTY ?

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Bullion-n-BTC on July 03, 2022, 11:05:47 PMI’ve got a few but if I’m not mistaken they aren’t actually loaded…. It’s some weird process once you find the actual site and read about them. Def cool pieces thoughtheir site specifically state it is funded -- whether it really is or not, I dont know. But they do claim that it isthey even go as far as to state how to redeem the funds...again - whether they are loaded or not? unknown - if someone wants to send me one to test, I will gladly test but I am not wasting the funds to buy one, that's for sure.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: IDK Its a bit smelly....After reading through the comments I am king of wondering why you would go to the trouble of loading a coin with such a small amount of Satoshi's, so small they dont even cover the cost of transferring them if you wanted to?I also might be out of touch with the pricing but €89.90 might be slightly over priced?granted it does have a nice case.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Is the QR code under the box lid the Public Key? Lets redeem one and see what happens. If the amount isn't enough to redeem, use the Public key and add more so that you can redeem it. I know a guy that is going to destroy one so that he can make a coin ring. I'll see if he can make a video of the peeling.

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on July 04, 2022, 12:26:06 PMThe coin was thoroughly discussed here when it was announced and collectively found shitty... Then of course, lot of us (me included) went and bought one because "it looked nice". So the maker is in profit and will indeed continue making other shitty products. Any questions?  Quote from: aoluain on July 04, 2022, 12:20:53 PMIDK Its a bit smellyAfter reading through the comments I am king of wondering why you would go to the trouble of loading a coin with such a small amount of Satoshi's, so small they dont even cover the cost of transferring them if you wanted to?I also might be out of touch with the pricing but €89.90 might be slightly over priced?granted it does have a nice case.This made me laugh. Great summary TLDR.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on July 04, 2022, 02:16:33 PMIs the QR code under the box lid the Public Key? Lets redeem one and see what happens. If the amount isn't enough to redeem, use the Public key and add more so that you can redeem it. I know a guy that is going to destroy one so that he can make a coin ring. I'll see if he can make a video of the peeling. no that qr code simply takes you to their website. there is no public address provided at all. as for redeeming it - 1000 sats should be doable - I have processed in the neighborhood of 70-100 txns thru a pay to many and the fee be less than 2k sats. so depending on the mempool load it is doable - though is it worth it? no... spend 700-800 sats to retrieve 1k sats - cheaper to just buy bitcoin than to buy this coin to get the sats.

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: I bought a couple of these.  They look good.  They’re minimally loaded silver coins.  The manufacturer can get away with selling loaded coins mainstream because the loaded amount is about equal to what it would cost to redeem the funds.  There’s so much misinformation about these coins.  Buy them for collectibility? Sure! Other than that, why discuss further?…

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.created_time: July 06, 2022, 05:53:59 AMLast edit: July 06, 2022, 03:45:10 PM by ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on July 04, 2022, 12:22:07 AMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on July 04, 2022, 12:18:56 AMThis coin actually pisses me off. Trying to piggyback on the success of Casascius and Lealana without actually putting in the work to be legit. Lets pretend to be physical bitcoin to get the customers. No address, not funded. I bet there's a 1-800 number the holo. Please call number and well mail you 2 dimes. $4.99 shipping and handling. Sounds like the Hyperion Gold scam, the 4 guardians coins. Anything from TWC is suspect to me nowadays, they often don't even have the coins they are selling. This one pisses me off as well, I mean I don't mind they are piggybacking myself, but the fact they claim each is loaded with 5k sats or some bullshit. I can already tell if there is some website involved, it will be a scam as far as getting any btc from them.  Where is @ChiBitCTY ?  Lol it kind of has the Hyperion gold smell to it, but as I stated earlier I’m really not positive these coins were discussing here have anything under those holograms. I’m looking forward to someone peeling one and letting the rest of us know.Owl- speaking of the devil, will DM you tom about Hyperion Quote from: YodasRedRocket on July 04, 2022, 09:20:17 PMI bought a couple of these.  They look good.  They’re minimally loaded silver coins.  The manufacturer can get away with selling loaded coins mainstream because the loaded amount is about equal to what it would cost to redeem the funds.  There’s so much misinformation about these coins.  Buy them for collectibility? Sure! Other than that, why discuss further?…Why not discuss it? There’s nothing wrong with doing so plus there’s still stuff left to be discussed with these coins. No one knows for sure if they are truly funded or not.
